channel.title: Energy Re-gain and drain
channel.description:
Okay, so i got a method that `Rich helped me with, for stat restoration. And so i thought "What about playerEnergy restoration!" so yeah, i am gonna go heads up with that.
The only problem i have encountered is the following:
isRunning2; i can use this to say "if isRunning2 == true" then remove 1% energy, the only problem is, that isRunning2 is only when the run option is selected, and not when the player actually runs! This is annoying. Does anyone know a variable or method for when the player is running, which i can use?
I appreciate all help, Thanks!!

item.title: Energy Re-gain and drain
item.dc:creator: @WRX WRX`
item.description:
@WRX wrote:

`Rich:

According to that method, it will drain once everytime you’re running.

Thanks, you the man =]

Read full topic

item.title: Energy Re-gain and drain
item.dc:creator: @WRX WRX`
item.description:
@WRX wrote:

  public void updateThisPlayerMovement(stream str) {
    if (mapRegionDidChange) {
      str.createFrame(73);
      str.writeWordA(mapRegionX+6); // for some reason the client substracts 6 from those values
      str.writeWord(mapRegionY+6);
    }
     
    if (didTeleport == true) {
      str.createFrameVarSizeWord(81);
      str.initBitAccess();
      str.writeBits(1, 1);
      str.writeBits(2, 3);
      // updateType
      str.writeBits(2, heightLevel);
      str.writeBits(1, 1);
      // set to true, if discarding (clientside) walking queue
      str.writeBits(1, (updateRequired) ? 1 : 0);
      str.writeBits(7, currentY);
      str.writeBits(7, currentX);
      return;
    }
     
    if (dir1 == -1) {
      // don't have to update the character position, because we're just standing
      str.createFrameVarSizeWord(81);
      str.initBitAccess();
      if (updateRequired) {
        // tell client there's an update block appended at the end
        str.writeBits(1, 1);
        str.writeBits(2, 0);
      } else {
        str.writeBits(1, 0);
      }
      if (DirectionCount < 50) {
        DirectionCount++;
      }
    } else {
      DirectionCount = 0;
      str.createFrameVarSizeWord(81);
      str.initBitAccess();
      str.writeBits(1, 1);
       
      if (dir2 == -1) {
        // send "walking packet"
        str.writeBits(2, 1);
        // updateType
        str.writeBits(3, misc.xlateDirectionToClient[dir1]);
        if (updateRequired) str.writeBits(1, 1);
        // tell client there's an update block appended at the end
        else str.writeBits(1, 0);
      } else {
        // send "running packet"
        str.writeBits(2, 2);
        // updateType
        str.writeBits(3, misc.xlateDirectionToClient[dir1]);
        str.writeBits(3, misc.xlateDirectionToClient[dir2]);
        if (updateRequired) str.writeBits(1, 1);
        // tell client there's an update block appended at the end
        else str.writeBits(1, 0);
        if (playerEnergy > 0) {
          playerEnergy -= 1;
        } else {
          isRunning2 = false;
        }
      }
    }
     
  }

Safe man.

Read full topic

item.title: Energy Re-gain and drain
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

public long EnergyDelay;

Add this in process;

if (playerEnergy < 100 && System.currentTimeMillis() - EnergyDelay > 2500) { playerEnergy++; sendQuest(""+playerEnergy+"%", 149); EnergyDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); }

Also, look in your player class, and post your updateThisPlayerMovement method.

Read full topic
